intro: Gethyllis kaapensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Gethyllis kaapensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to Mediterranean climates.
